The  Lead Data Scientist  will manage multiple data science projects including but not limited to assessing business needs, research, identifying data science opportunities, designing, developing innovative methodologies, data modeling, evaluating and execution to solve complex business problems in alignment with organizational goals and objectives using independent judgement. You will lead data scientist whowill also integrate with cross functional teams and manage stakeholders. As the Lead Data scientists you will be a technical leader who is able to bring in new technologies and implement across organization. You will be responsible for advising and mentoring junior data scientists and analysts.   Essential Functions  Lead multiple concurrent projects and accommodate frequent interruptions and changing priorities and ability to make independent decisions  Partner with cross functional teams to assess complex business needs and design business experiments by understanding the organizational goals and objectives  Communicate actionable insights and integrate multiple analytical projects to solve business problems in an efficient manner and understand the effectiveness of interventions  Proactively identify and communicate roadblocks. Evaluate and suggest alternatives to overcome.  Collaborate with data scientists, data analysts, data engineers and visualization developers on analytical projects to complete the data science life cycle in a successful manner  Implementation of new data science technologies across the enterprise  Effectively lead meetings with customers and guide discussion and decision making.  Identify, define and translate complex business needs/problems into analytical questions by working directly with cross functional business partners along with project scope and project management.  Design and execute advanced machine learning experiments, models, algorithms, and visualizations independently understand data sources and limitations, warehousing system and the impact of the data on business decisions and propose new data sources that can be utilized for advanced analytics based on research  Identify, retrieve, and manipulate structured and unstructured data from internal and external datasets  Apply advanced and innovative statistical and computational methodologies to provide actionable insights and identify strategic opportunities that optimize quality, consumer experience, and healthcare costs.  Develop scalable, efficient, and automated processes for large scale data analyses and model development, validation, and implementation.  Implement business feedback loop into the developed models and also develop automated process to evaluate models performance from time to time  Write technical reports, white papers, and publications.  Stay current on new processes and technology in Data Science and provide findings on advanced analytical and computational methodologies to other Data Scientists and analysts.  Responsible for developing talent and effectively leading small teams.   Required Skills:  7+ years related work experience in a Data Scientist or similar role  Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience Data Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer science (e.g. specialization: Machine learning/Artificial Intelligence /Visualization, databases, and Big Data), Statistics, Epidemiology, Health Services Research, or closely related field with Data Science specialization  Requires experience with statistical packages – 4-7 years of SAS /R/Python, SAS EG, and SAS EM. Also requires experience in SQL, Tableau/any visiualization tool (Power BI).  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Strong willingness and emerging ability to lead projects and manage project phases or smaller projects in their entirety (includes project management).  Ability to partner with customers across the organization to assess needs and define business questions. Influencing customers to take action on analytical insights.  Ability to communicate results and insights, both verbally and written (including visual graphics), in a clear and concise manner to a non-technical audience.  Must have applied experience with advanced statistics e.g. predictive analytics models  Must have applied experience in Machine Learning  Must have experience in Visual analytics  Experience with large data sets  Excel/PowerPoint skills (including visual graphics)  Must have experience working with other teams - IT, product, data warehousing etc  Must have strong teamwork and collaborative skills  Ability to prioritize work, independently  Ability to prioritize projects and resource planning  Proven ability to meet and exceed deadlines  Strong decision making ability  Ability to influence decision makers  Clear proven track record of creating strong actionable insights that drive decision making and business process  Strong written and oral communication skills  Experience interacting with, and presenting to, customers  Experience managing projects from end-to-end, including project plan development   Preferred Skills:  Master’s degree Applied Mathematics, Computer science (e.g. specialization: Machine learning/Artificial Intelligence /Visualization, databases, and Big Data), Statistics, Epidemiology, Health Services Research, or closely related field with Data Science specialization  Experience in Big Data - e.g. Hadoop  Experience with other tools –e.g. Tableau, R, and Netezza  Business Intelligence tool development  Other programming experience - Java, Perl, Python, UNIX/Linux scripting  Healthcare, medical, or pharmaceutical work experience  Experience with analysis around quality, consumer experience, and healthcare costs  SAS certification  Experience in consumer analytics  Experience in advanced business analytics   General Physical Demands  Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects.  Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally.  We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities.   Florida Blue is a federal contractor. In accordance with the President’s Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, all Florida Blue employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, unless an employee qualifies for an accommodation for religious or medical reasons. This requirement applies regardless of work location.

The Water Supply Data Scientist in the Water Supply Bureau plays a key role in managing and coordinating the collection, organization, analysis and evaluation of information to support the District’s Water Supply Bureau staff and projects. This frequently involves working on multiple projects concurrently to deal with tight deadlines,  Responsibilities include: pre- and post-processing large datasets for and from Modflow models. Data analysis for the Bureau also involves developing, maintaining and using analytic tools to collect water use demand data from several sources, including the District’s Regulatory database; water level, and water quality data from DBHydro; merging data from external sources with internal sources; and, interpretation, analysis, and reporting of data results employing statistical techniques.  Data analysis is a key step in data collection that involves data cleansing and validation -managing missing values, removing errors or inaccurate values, and elimination of outliers to enhance the quality of data. Wherever possible this work will make use of analytic tools to provide reproducible results and document the steps taken to provide the final products.  Other responsibilities included in information and data analysis are the production of graphics for water supply plan stakeholder meetings and plans, preparation and formatting of this data to support modeling efforts, evaluation of groundwater data including the preparation of hydrographs and water quality graphs and/or maps.   Employment Guidelines: Bachelor’s Degree in Natural or Physical Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering or related field and at least four (4) years of qualifying experience.  This position may be filled at the secondary level of:   Water Supply Data Analyst (Scientist 3)   Employment Guidelines: Bachelor’s Degree in Natural or Physical Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering or related field and at least two (2) years of qualifying experience.  Candidates must demonstrate the ability to and effectively communicate in written and oral manner to District staff and other agencies.  Knowledge of District Regulatory and DBHydro database systems is a fundamental skill required for this position. If currently unfamiliar with these systems, a candidate will be required to develop this knowledge as a number one priority.  Expertise with Microsoft Excel and/or other data analysis tools is required.  Analytic tools include the development and use of complex MS Excel spreadsheets, Oracle SQL queries, FORTRAN, Python and/or R scripts and programs. MS Excel skills include proficient and demonstratable use of formulas, pivot tables, data filtering, data modeling, slicers, macros, etc. Oracle SQL skills should include multi-table joins and complex ‘where’ clauses. FORTRAN, Python and/or R scripting skills are desired, and proficiency with some programming language to process large data sets and automate repetitive tasks is required.  Additionally, some experience with GIS and Python scripting in ArcGIS desired. Familiarity with Microsoft Office software is required. Strong technical writing and communication skills are necessary.   License: Valid State of Florida Driver's license required.   Physical Requirements/ Working Environment: Due to the District's response role and in the total scope of emergency management, this position may at times, be required to provide support before, during and after major storm events and emergency situations, such as hurricanes or other declared emergencies, depending on assigned emergency response role.  Veterans' Preference: Pursuant to Chapter 295, Florida Statutes, candidates eligible for Veterans’ Preference will receive preference in employment for vacancies and are encouraged to apply. Candidates claiming Veterans’ Preference must attach supporting documentation with each submission that includes character of service (for example, DD Form 214 Member Copy #4) along with any other documentation as required by Rule 55A-7, Florida Administrative Code. All documentation is due by the close of the job posting.  Salary Minimum  $54,371.20  Salary Midpoint:  $64,625.60  Organization  WR4204231 Groundwater Technical Analysis

Job Summary: Do you love the art of using data to solve complex business problems? We do too – and would be excited to have you join our team at Walt Disney World!  Our mission as part of the Commercial Strategy organization is to put our data assets to work, and apply quantitative techniques to discover previously unknown insights about our Guests and business. We get to work directly with the major decision-makers at Disney who shape the Walt Disney World experience. Through our insights, we help form and improve Disney products and offerings.  This is a unique role, in that it looks across a variety of functional areas, and enables the creation of holistic models to better predict and prescribe improvements to the overall Walt Disney World business. A position like this puts you in the middle of the main commercial decisions of the company – and is a great way to showcase your data science skills!  The Senior Analyst – Data Science currently reports to the Lead Data Science and is an individual contributor role.  Responsibilities: While each day will be different, with rotating priorities, the main themes for this role include you being a(n):  Data Wrangler: You understand data and how it supports solving business problems. You will translate the business and analytic needs into data requirements to ensure you have the information you need to solve the problem, and work with technology partners to troubleshoot data quality You will work in a large, complex data environment, compiling and cleansing data across a variety of domains to create a foundation for your analytic work.  Analytics Creator: You leverage data science skills to deliver mathematical models and adhoc statistical analyses. You will conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data collection and exploration, feature generation and reduction, and algorithm selection. You will determine the best techniques to use to solve problems efficiently and effectively, examining all aspects of the analytics curve across statistical, predictive, and prescriptive methods.  Insights Translator: You interpret outputs of analyses and models to make relevant recommendations. You will draw inferences, quantify uncertainty/risk, and identify limitations to accurately summarize your findings, relating them back to the problem at hand. You will successfully craft key takeaways and next steps in the context of business actionability, while facilitating the integration of your work into the decision making process. Basic Qualifications: 3-5 years of experience in a technical role (analytics, mathematics, software engineering) Knowledge of data science/advanced analytic concepts Experience developing presentations and reports using quantitative information for non-technical stakeholders Proficiency in at least one programming language such as R or Python Advanced knowledge of relational databases and SQL programming Knowledge of industry leading data and analytic tools (e.g., Snowflake, Git, Sagemaker, Dataiku, Tableau) Time-management skills, with ability to prioritize multiple requests and communicate status to partners/leadership Required Education Required Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, mathematics, econometrics)   Preferred Education Preference for a Masters

job_title: Associate, Data Scientist Engineer - Advisory Data Organization
job_Description: The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory. Key to KPMG’s Advisory growth strategy is embedding data & analytics in everything we do, and in all aspects of our client delivery. KPMG is currently seeking a Data Science Engineer to join the Activation and Operations group within the Signals Repository team which is central to KPMG’s Advisory Data Organization (ADO). The Signals Repository is a KPMG created platform to enable data scientists & analysts to build machine learning (ML) enabled business solutions using open-source data (see video). Today, the platform connects to 100K regularly updated data elements from around the globe, which power applications across insurance, financial services, consumer products & healthcare industries to name a few. Whether determining the best location to site a new restaurant/bank/clinic, estimating risk of a home/auto/individual insurance claim, forecasting national inflation rates or monitoring COVID-19 hot-spots (see video), access to the data & tools accelerate & enhance the solution builds. The platform has already enabled the delivery of $50M+ in engagement revenue and the platform continues to grow in terms of breadth & functionality. This exciting role will require working with the Signals Repository team to develop reusable solutions and tools to enable promotion of Data Science assets to Advisory professionals and enhance client delivery. KPMG is currently seeking an Associate to join our Advisory Data Organization. Responsibilities: Work on cross functional team to deliver reusable Data Science assets to Advisory teams for client solutions Collaborate with Advisory teams to understand their client抯 business problem and what solution the Signals Repository has that can be leveraged Develop and maintain data pipelines that combine data from multiple sources, runs a model and delivers data to a location for use by other applications Perform code reviews of programs/applications submitted by other members of the Signals Repository team Modify or create data curations based on business requirements from Advisory Manages the ingestion, onboarding, and maintenance of data assets and reusable data-driven solutions within the Signals Repository to enable our client-facing professionals with Data Science accelerators for enhanced client delivery Qualifications: Minimum two years of recent experience developing data pipelines using Python and in data wrangling and analysis using tools such as Python/Pandas/Jupyter Notebook and/or R/RStudio and working with Unix/Linux systems including basic commands and shell scripting; minimum one year of experience working w/ cloud environments such as AWS, Azure and/or GCP Bachelor's degree or higher from an accredited college/university in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering, Statistics, or a similar field Analytical mindset with a desire to gain a tactical knowledge of KPMG抯 Data Science assets Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong programming experience using Python Experience using Git and Jira; understanding of statistical concepts and ability to learn more advanced techniques performed by Data Scientists Ability to travel up to 10% as required to support firm engagements KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please.

job_title: Operations Research Analyst/ Data Scientist (OR/SA) Journeyman
job_Description: Job Description: Prescient Edge is seeking an  Operations Research/ Data Analyst Journeyman  to support a Federal government client. Prescient Edge is subject to Executive Order 14042, which requires that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  As a Operations Research/ Data Analyst Journeyman, you will:  Provide on-site technical expertise and capability for assessing operations and analyzing plans, including support to contingency operations  Plan, develop, implement, and facilitate efforts to assess operations in the USCENTCOM AOR and analyze plans, such as the TCP, OPLANS, CONPLANS, OPORDS, FRAGOS, commander’s estimates, and other plans or operations  Provide OR and/or DS/A in support of Operations, Campaign, and Strategic Assessments  Support OPTs, Crisis Action Teams (CATs), and other assigned B2C2WG as needed. Planning support includes: participating in mission analysis activities to ensure measurable and achievable end states, objectives, desired effects, and tasks are developed; leading USCENTCOM planning teams in developing assessment frameworks and methodologies; managing planning teams in assessment activities; and integrating assessment activities and findings across the staff  Educate, train, assist and guide staff members during the assessment processes  Support the planning and execution of exercises to reinforce staff training and proficiency in assessments activities  Integrate assessment findings with USCENTCOM’s Quarterly Readiness Reviews  Integrate assessment findings with the annual Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) CJA/AJA and other Joint Strategic Planning System (JSPS) activities  Provide technical expertise to assist in implementing USCENTCOM sponsored initiatives which improve DoD-wide Joint and Service doctrine for Operations and Campaign Assessments  Assist the CCJ8 in its role as the secretariat for the Campaign Assessment Board (CAB), Campaign Assessment Working Group (CAWG), and the USCENTCOM Assessment Cell (CAC) and shall support all other B2C2WG as necessary  Execute analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency, or program criticality, requiring a variety of OR techniques and tools  Apply conventional OR methods and techniques to support assessments, exercising sound military and analytic judgment in applying standard professional OR practices  Exercise creativity and innovation in selecting and applying OR techniques and tools to support assessments, methods, processes, enhance assessment performance, or increase efficiency and effectiveness  Use statistical analysis, trend analysis and forecasting, data visualization and modeling, risk analysis, or other methods to analyze information and develop practical solutions to fit specific situations  Work on a wide variety of ambiguous, complex, compounding problems given only a skeletal framework or foundation for departure, characterized by either their expansive breadth or depth where analytic precedents and guidelines often do not exist, which may require unconventional approaches or the application and adaptation of sophisticated analytical techniques producing original results  Perform work with a marked degree of technical authority, assuming responsibility for each step of the analytic process, the thoroughness of the analysis, significance of the findings and effectiveness of the presentation  Initiate, oversee, and/or develop requirements from a project’s inception to conclusion for extremely complex programs  Develop project requirements, plans, and schedules to support assessment activities  Determine the nature of ill-structured or broadly stated problems, identify problem ramifications, and provide technical expertise concerning the validity of assumptions and the assessment criteria  Define problems, conduct research, develop analysis design, perform data collection and reduction, display data for analysis, examine the underlying relationships, select appropriate methods or techniques, formulate mathematical expressions, construct analytical models for understanding data, draw conclusions and operational insights from assessments, and prepare reports describing and justifying the results  Work independently or as part of a team to complete projects, potentially as a part of a larger project or a phase of analysis  Perform assignments arising from previous assessments that exposed problems or were highlighted in other applications  Develop and support new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments (e.g., data mining and analysis, systems analysis, social analysis, data visualization and modeling)  Integrate analytical applications (e.g., R programming language) and Microsoft applications (e.g., Excel, SharePoint, Access, and Word) to support assessments  Create data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis  Develop tools and reports that assist users with access and data analysis  Develop and manage DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection  Use, modify, and tailor Client assessment tools (e.g., C2IE)  Provide support regarding inbound and outbound tasks utilizing the USCENTCOM Task Management Tool  Verify and validate data for accuracy to ensure precise analysis results and apply a wide range of analytical data-mining techniques to produce accurate data sets  Provide input and consolidate feedback of past, current, and future activities for the CCJ5, to include, but not limited to, weekly and quarterly updates and executive summaries for the leadership  Coordinate with operational technical experts  Coordinate assessment support and interface regularly with the HQ staff and DOD partners, Joint, Interagency, Coalition, and NATO, and shall support assessments conducted by those partners  Document working groups’ results, conferences, in-progress reviews, and other milestone activities  Document working groups’ results, conferences, IPRs, and other milestone activities  Brief senior leaders, potentially on controversial and/or sensitive results and findings that may involve differences of opinion or varying interpretations among experienced and respected professionals  Routinely communicate with, prepare correspondence and presentations for, and advise senior leaders  Generate finished products for presentation and final reporting   Benefits  At Prescient Edge, we believe that acting with integrity and serving our employees is the key to everyone's success. To that end, we provide employees with a best in class benefits package that includes:  A competitive salary with performance bonus opportunities  Comprehensive healthcare benefits, including medical, vision, dental, and orthodontia coverage  A substantial retirement plan with no vesting schedule  Career development opportunities, including on-the-job training, tuition reimbursement, and networking  A positive work environment where employees are respected, supported, and engaged    Job Requirements:  Active TS/SCI security clearance The position shall be staffed by individuals with OR and/or DS experience and hold a bachelor’s degree in a technical field, such as OR, data science, math, engineering, science, computer science, or related field, master’s preferred  3 years of OR and/or DS experience, with a minimum of 1 year of experience of OR and/or DS experience at a Combatant Command staff, Joint or Combined Command Headquarters, or Defense Department equivalent. Minimum of 1 year of operation assessment experience preferred.  Ability to work independently or as part of a small team in conducting analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency or program criticality; requiring a variety of OR and DS techniques and tools.  Ability to communicate, prepare correspondence and presentations at the 4-Star General Officer level.  Ability to develop and support new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments  Ability to integrate analytical applications/software programs and Microsoft applications to support assessments  Ability to create data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis, DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection

You must be a US Citizen or Green Card holder, no Visa's now or in the future please.   What You Need To Know: Strong SQL and Excel skills are required Must be US Citizen or Green Card Holder  Overview: The Supplier Analyst will serve as the primary vendor contact to market, manage, and advance proprietary sales data tools. This role will provide training, insight assessment, and analytical support to help suppliers maximize the use of the tool and achieve their sales goals.  Primary Responsibilities: Ensure that market information in the database is accurate and up-to-date Analyze and report on key performance indicators and trends by the supplier Schedule and conduct training sessions for new suppliers; create and update training module and materials Set up access for new supplier users on their desktops, laptops, tablets, and smartphones Manage all supplier correspondence; communicate with suppliers regarding system updates and expiring subscriptions Maintain active supplier subscription, license, and annual billing information Evaluate and recommend new database tools and processes to lead to increased supplier interests Develop new analytical processes to preserve a competitive advantage over third-party vendors Analyze market data and draft a quarterly State of the Industry report to send to suppliers Actively market the process to new suppliers for program expansion Develop market research, data analysis, and interpretation of market measures for use in supplier presentations Collaborate with Trade Development Team to develop strategic data modeling tools and databases Perform other job-related duties as assigned Southern Glazer’s Wine and Spirits provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.   About Southern Glazer's Wine and Spirits:   Southern Glazer's Wine & Spirits is the largest distributor of beverage alcohol in North America, and proud to be a multi-generational, family-owned company. Southern Glazer’s has a proud history of consistently delivering impeccable service in 44 states, plus the District of Columbia, Canada and the Caribbean. It’s all made possible by our employees. Our careers focus on delivering a captivating and rewarding experience. Challenging our colleagues every step of the way, we provide the tools for them to grow, succeed and accomplish both their personal and professional goals. Together, we can deliver the highest quality service for our suppliers and our customers while we put you on the career path you’ve been looking for.Southern Glazer’s is nationally recognized by its supplier partners as well as by its customers for its state-of-the-art distribution capabilities and its leading-edge information technology. We also believe in the importance of giving back, being a socially responsible corporate citizen and making generous contributions to national, state and local charitable organizations.

JOB OVERVIEW: The Sr. Business Data Analyst uses data to create business value for finance, operations, marketing, HR, and other functions. This is a decision support role that will consult with business partners to identify the business problem, find relevant data sources, prepare data, perform analysis, and present insights. Projects can be ad hoc analysis, automated processes, or dashboards. This individual will also partner with data science, engineering, and business intelligence to create production analytics products. This person must have a passion for learning, data, and problem solving.   ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Ask great questions and develop many hypotheses for each business problem Test hypotheses using appropriate data, statistics, and analytic tools Automate repeatable processes Make relevant data visualizations or dashboards Know and understand data available at Darden Consult with business partners on data and business problems and develop solutions Perform financial analysis and ROI to estimate impact of analytic solutions Create readable, repeatable workflows or code Continually learn and share your knowledge liberally Maintain automated processes Train and mentor analysts with less experience   REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS: Three to five years of experience in analytics Knowledge of relational data and moderate experience with SQL Knowledge of statistics Strong problem solving and logic skills Proficient in data analysis and analytics tools (Alteryx or R/Python) Experience in data preparation and automation for dashboarding Proficient in visualization, dashboard design, and associated tools (Power BI, Tableau) Strong business acumen Strong project management skills Strong communication skills both written and verbal Ability to complete projects and produce great work in a timely manner   REQUIRED EDUCATION: Bachelor’s degree   OTHER KEY QUALIFICATIONS: Work well on a team Ability to work independently Extremely curious about data Strong desire to learn new analytic techniques and get better every day   PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: Graduate degree in technical field Experience with Alteryx, Power BI, Snowflake, Databricks Experience in marketing analysis, A/B testing, Design of Experiments Knowledge of restaurant industry

job_title: Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science
job_Description: Job no:  500766  Work type:  Faculty  Location:  Main Campus (Orlando)  Categories:  Sciences   Classification Title:  Endowed Professorship (Open Rank), Statistics and Data Science   Administrative Title:  No Administrative Function   Job Description:  The Department of Statistics and Data Science at the University of Central Florida (UCF) invites applications for a 9-month, tenure-track or tenured endowed professorship position (open rank), anticipated to begin August 2022. The position will carry a rank commensurate with the candidate’s demonstrated record of teaching, research and service.   We seek faculty candidates with a background in statistical learning, artificial intelligence, or machine learning. The successful applicant must have a strong record in research that is commensurate with a tenure-track or tenured position in the Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF.   Furthermore, the ideal candidate will be an excellent mentor who can help students master both the theoretical and practical skills needed for success in this highly interdisciplinary field. We are especially interested in an individual who can lead the effort to build a nationally recognized big data research program. The selected candidate should also contribute through their research, teaching, and service to the diversity and excellence of our academic community to foster an environment in which faculty, staff, and students from a variety of backgrounds, cultures, and personal experiences are welcomed and can thrive.   The Department of Statistics and Data Science at UCF is dedicated to high-caliber research at the intersection of statistics, statistical machine learning, deep learning, data mining, computer science, and applied mathematics, and to developing the statistical and analytical abilities of students that are necessary in an increasingly data-driven world. The Ph.D. program in Big Data Analytics offered by the department is the first of its kind in Florida, and one of only a few programs globally, that trains students and researchers to tackle the scale and complexity of real-world datasets encountered in contemporary industrial and academic settings. In addition to the Ph.D. in Big Data Analytics, the department offers two undergraduate degrees, one in Statistics and one in Actuarial Science; an M.S. degree with two tracks in Data Science and Statistics, and an SAS Data Mining Certificate program. In 2021, the department is expected to launch a joint B.S. degree program in Data Science between the College of Sciences (COS) and the College of Engineering and Computer Science (CECS). For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/statistics/.   The College of Sciences houses most of the university’s natural, computational, and social sciences in eight departments, two schools, and several centers. The college’s programs play a key role in advancing UCF as a national research university that is determined to help students from all backgrounds achieve success. For more information, visit https://sciences.ucf.edu/.   UCF, located in Orlando, Florida, is classified as a Very High Research Activity university by the Carnegie Foundation. With a diverse student body of more than 72,000 students, UCF is one of the largest universities in the country. The university offers more than 200-degree programs. UCF is committed to diversity and is designated as a Hispanic Serving Institution. For more information, visit http://www.ucf.edu.   Department:  AA-College of Sciences, Department of Statistics and Data Science   Type of Appointment:  Regular   Advertised Annual Salary:  Negotiable   Minimum Qualifications:  A doctorate in Statistics, Data Science, or a closely related field from an accredited institution is required.   In order to obtain tenure, the selected candidate must have a demonstrated record of teaching, research and service commensurate with rank.   Preferred Qualifications:  Preference will be given to candidates who have a strong record of funding, extensive experience in mentoring/supervising Ph.D. students, and have made outstanding contributions in the areas of data science, big data analytics, statistics, high-dimensional data analysis, machine learning, and/or deep learning and have a willingness to teach courses in these areas.   Special Instructions to Applicants:   Additional Application Materials Required:  UCF requires all applications and supporting documents to be submitted electronically through the Human Resources website, https://www.ucf.edu/jobs/. In addition to the online application, interested candidates should upload the following: a CV, a letter of interest, and statements of research and teaching. Additionally, applicants must provide the names and contact information for three professional references.   NOTE: Please have all application documents ready when applying so they can be attached at that time. Once the online submission process is finalized, the system does not allow applicants to submit additional documents at a later date.   Review of applications will begin September 1, 2021 and continue until the position is filled.   Questions regarding the position should be directed to Edgard Maboudou, Search Committee Chair, at edgard.maboudou@ucf.edu.   Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:  As an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer, UCF encourages all qualified applicants to apply, including women, veterans, individuals with disabilities, and members of traditionally underrepresented populations. UCF's Equal Opportunity Statement can be viewed at: http://www.oie.ucf.edu/documents/PresidentsStatement.pdf. As a Florida public university, UCF makes all application materials and selection procedures available to the public upon request.  The University of Central Florida is proud to be a smoke-free campus and an E-Verify employer.    Advertised:  July 16, 2021 Eastern Daylight Time  Applications close:

Job Title: Data Scientist (Risk) Location: Orlando, Florida Manager: Head of Data Science About LSQ LSQ is a technology-driven provider of accounts receivable financing to companies who need working capital but may not be able to obtain sufficient financing from their bank. Our focus is to help businesses release the liquidity tied up in their accounts receivable. With financing from LSQ, a business can purchase more inventory, fill more orders, and take advantage of new growth opportunities. Our technology and data driven approach to providing working capital, along with our accounts receivable management services, allows our clients to driving business success. Job Overview LSQ is searching for a Data Scientist (Risk) to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for building data driven tools to automate and scale risk decisions – decision points include, fraud detection, commercial credit analysis, and invoice payment behavior. The ideal candidate is an experienced researcher and data wrangler who enjoys applying complex theories to solve real world business problems. The Data Scientist will need to collaborate effectively with both technical (engineers, data experts) and non-technical (business users) colleagues to bring the data to life. Responsibilities of Data Scientist (Risk) We have 20+ years of real-world commercial data – we’ve observed businesses and their interactions with other businesses across market cycles, industries, and catastrophic events. Build risk tools that optimize for velocity and scale. Build risk tools that optimize science & art – you will work with risk experts who have been in the trenches (and learned from losses). Augment human decisions with machine. Lay the foundation for scale. A data science framework for optimal data acquisition, model training and deployment. Don’t take short-cuts. Bring quantitative and statistical rigor to your body of work. Lead by example. You are joining a data team at ground-level. Building and inserting a data team, into a 20+ year old company (organism) will be hard, but rewarding. Qualifications for Risk Data Scientist Curiosity, Grit, and Humility 5+ years of experience of hands-on data science role Previous experience of building commercial finance risk tools should be beneficial, but not required Bachelor or Masters degree in Data Science, Operations Research, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, or another quantitative field A toolkit of modern data science techniques Experience with any data science tools/packages: Python, R, SAS, XGBoost, TensorFlow, NLTK Experience with any big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Data Bricks Experience with any reporting tools: Tableau Server, Power BI, SSRS, Excel Experience with any AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift, Aurora, S3 Experience with any Stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming Position Type and Expected Hours of Work:  This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Physical Demands:  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk and stoop, kneel, crouch. Travel:  There will be minimal travel required for this position. LSQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived, race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), sexual orientation, parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, any other non-merit based factor or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Our leadership team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here  http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/poster.cfm Job Type: Full-time

Description: Job Title: Sr. Data Scientist - ADAPT  Job Code AS 20212508-68266  Job Location:  St. Petersburg, FL  Job Description:  Aviation Data Analytics for Pilot Training (ADAPT) is an R&D project by L3Harris to redefine the pilot training journey, using data to make training more effective and support the move towards Evidence Based Training and Competency assessments. We are building a cloud platform which collates data from Simulators, Instructors, Black Box Flight Data Recorders and Training Assessments and utilizes Data Science techniques and Machine Learning models to extract key insights which will help Instructors more quickly identify root cause issues and Pilots in understanding their performance.  As a Senior Data Scientist, you will conduct multi-flight analysis across large datasets of flight data to discover insights into our customer’s operations. You will develop data analysis tools and help integrate ML models into flight data services products, produce customer friendly presentations of analysis results, use flight data to help improve aircraft and pilot performance and monitor flight safety to help create safer skies. Essential Functions:  Delegate jobs to other Data Scientists in order to realize the successful completion of projects.  Monitor the performance of Data Scientists and providing them with tactical advice if needed.  Use data science techniques to solve the problems of internal and external customers.  Research, prototype, develop and implement machine learning algorithms to discover trends and patterns to help create safer skies.  Liaise with customers for ad-hoc data analysis and development of predictive models using a variety of data sources.  Present the results of the analyses and models in a customer friendly manner.  Liaise with the software development team to integrate ML models into L3Harris products.  Help automate business processes using ML techniques to help free up staff to work on more complicated problems.  Actively contribute to improving the data science process at L3Harris.  Support the analysis team in their use of multi-flight analysis such that they may help their customers identify flight safety risks.  Present and attend conferences relevant to ongoing work.  Recommend new data analysis approaches where applicable.  Stay informed about developments in the Data Science and adjacent fields to ensure that outputs are always relevant.   TECH STACK   Python / NumPy / Pandas / C  Django / Flask / Celery / RabbitMQ  JavaScript / React  Linux / Docker / Kubernetes  AWS & Azure   Qualifications: BS/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.  6+ years related experience in software development.  Outstanding supervision and mentorship skills.  Capacity to foster a healthy, stimulating work environment that frequently harnesses teamwork.  Good understanding of statistics and ability to communicate statistical concepts to those with little experience.  Experience of unsupervised and supervised learning techniques.  Experience of time series analysis.  Python development in Jupyter Notebooks using pandas, NumPy,SciPy, Matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn.  Understanding of database structures and can create complex SQL queries.  The ability to clean/transform database content and to analyse and interpret data.  Ability to plan work and meet deadlines.  Clarity of communication and strong problem-solving skills.  Use of big data frameworks (Hadoop, Spark, Dask)  Knowledge of ML experiment workflow tools e.g. ModelDB, MLflow, DVC.  Knowledge of Bayesian modelling.  Knowledge of Keras, Tensorflow, Recurrent Neural Networks, Convolutional Neural Networks, Reinforcement Learning and intelligent agents.  Knowledge of Aviation and Safety systems.  Knowledge of computer-based training systems.

ECS is a federal contractor. As such, we are subject an Executive Order requiring all employees of federal contractors to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 by December 8, 2021. Therefore, by applying for this position, you understand that you will be required to verify that you have been, or will be, fully vaccinated by December 8, or to verify that you cannot be vaccinated due to a legally recognized exception to the vaccine mandate set forth in the Executive Order.  Note:   An individual is not considered to be fully vaccinated until two weeks after receiving the second vaccine dosage in a vaccine regimen involving two vaccines.  The above does not apply to personnel applying to United States Postal Service positions, however, as an ECS employee you will be required to complete the ECS COVID-19 survey to be compliant with Executive Order 14024.   ECS is seeking a  Data Management Scientist – Lead  to work in our  MacDill AFB, FL  office.  Please Note: This position is contingent upon contract award.  Job Description: The successful candidate will have senior subject matter expertise in data science within Military, Federal, or Intelligence organizations with demonstratable history of designing, developing, and maintaining data architectures and data visualization tools. Must have the ability to gather, analyze, model, and interpret large sets of structured and unstructured data to discover solutions to improve data exploitation.  Responsibilities:   Supports all operational data requirements for HQ USCENTCOM Operations Directorate.  Provides oversight and monitors performance of Data Management contractor team.  Candidate must be able to interact professionally and successfully with Government operational representatives.  Candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to translate highly technical information to a broad, operational audience. Job Description: Prescient Edge is seeking a  Senior Operations Research/ Data Analyst  to support a Federal government client. Prescient Edge is subject to Executive Order 14042, which requires that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.  As a Senior Operations Research/ Data Analyst, you will:  Provide on-site technical expertise and capability for assessing operations and analyzing plans, including support to contingency operations  Plan, develop, implement, and facilitate efforts to assess operations in the USCENTCOM AOR and analyze plans, such as the TCP, OPLANS, CONPLANS, OPORDS, FRAGOS, commander’s estimates, and other plans or operations  Provide OR and/or DS/A in support of Operations, Campaign, and Strategic Assessments  Support OPTs, Crisis Action Teams (CATs), and other assigned B2C2WG as needed. Planning support includes: participating in mission analysis activities to ensure measurable and achievable end states, objectives, desired effects, and tasks are developed; leading USCENTCOM planning teams in developing assessment frameworks and methodologies; managing planning teams in assessment activities; and integrating assessment activities and findings across the staff  Educate, train, assist and guide staff members during the assessment processes  Support the planning and execution of exercises to reinforce staff training and proficiency in assessments activities  Integrate assessment findings with USCENTCOM’s Quarterly Readiness Reviews  Integrate assessment findings with the annual Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) CJA/AJA and other Joint Strategic Planning System (JSPS) activities  Provide technical expertise to assist in implementing USCENTCOM sponsored initiatives which improve DoD-wide Joint and Service doctrine for Operations and Campaign Assessments  Assist the CCJ8 in its role as the secretariat for the Campaign Assessment Board (CAB), Campaign Assessment Working Group (CAWG), and the USCENTCOM Assessment Cell (CAC) and shall support all other B2C2WG as necessary  Execute analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency, or program criticality, requiring a variety of OR techniques and tools  Apply conventional OR methods and techniques to support assessments, exercising sound military and analytic judgment in applying standard professional OR practices  Exercise creativity and innovation in selecting and applying OR techniques and tools to support assessments, methods, processes, enhance assessment performance, or increase efficiency and effectiveness  Use statistical analysis, trend analysis and forecasting, data visualization and modeling, risk analysis, or other methods to analyze information and develop practical solutions to fit specific situations  Work on a wide variety of ambiguous, complex, compounding problems given only a skeletal framework or foundation for departure, characterized by either their expansive breadth or depth where analytic precedents and guidelines often do not exist, which may require unconventional approaches or the application and adaptation of sophisticated analytical techniques producing original results  Perform work with a marked degree of technical authority, assuming responsibility for each step of the analytic process, the thoroughness of the analysis, significance of the findings and effectiveness of the presentation  Initiate, oversee, and/or develop requirements from a project’s inception to conclusion for extremely complex programs  Develop project requirements, plans, and schedules to support assessment activities  Determine the nature of ill-structured or broadly stated problems, identify problem ramifications, and provide technical expertise concerning the validity of assumptions and the assessment criteria  Define problems, conduct research, develop analysis design, perform data collection and reduction, display data for analysis, examine the underlying relationships, select appropriate methods or techniques, formulate mathematical expressions, construct analytical models for understanding data, draw conclusions and operational insights from assessments, and prepare reports describing and justifying the results  Work independently or as part of a team to complete projects, potentially as a part of a larger project or a phase of analysis  Perform assignments arising from previous assessments that exposed problems or were highlighted in other applications  Develop and support new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments (e.g., data mining and analysis, systems analysis, social analysis, data visualization and modeling)  Integrate analytical applications (e.g., R programming language) and Microsoft applications (e.g., Excel, SharePoint, Access, and Word) to support assessments  Create data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis  Develop tools and reports that assist users with access and data analysis  Develop and manage DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection  Use, modify, and tailor Client assessment tools (e.g., C2IE)  Provide support regarding inbound and outbound tasks utilizing the USCENTCOM Task Management Tool  Verify and validate data for accuracy to ensure precise analysis results and apply a wide range of analytical data-mining techniques to produce accurate data sets  Provide input and consolidate feedback of past, current, and future activities for the CCJ5, to include, but not limited to, weekly and quarterly updates and executive summaries for the leadership  Coordinate with operational technical experts  Coordinate assessment support and interface regularly with the HQ staff and DOD partners, Joint, Interagency, Coalition, and NATO, and shall support assessments conducted by those partners  Document working groups’ results, conferences, in-progress reviews, and other milestone activities  Document working groups’ results, conferences, IPRs, and other milestone activities  Brief senior leaders, potentially on controversial and/or sensitive results and findings that may involve differences of opinion or varying interpretations among experienced and respected professionals  Routinely communicate with, prepare correspondence and presentations for, and advise senior leaders  Generate finished products for presentation and final reporting   Benefits  At Prescient Edge, we believe that acting with integrity and serving our employees is the key to everyone's success. To that end, we provide employees with a best in class benefits package that includes:  A competitive salary with performance bonus opportunities  Comprehensive healthcare benefits, including medical, vision, dental, and orthodontia coverage  A substantial retirement plan with no vesting schedule  Career development opportunities, including on-the-job training, tuition reimbursement, and networking  A positive work environment where employees are respected, supported, and engaged    Job Requirements:  Active TS/SCI security clearance Minimum of 10 years of experience 5 years of assessments experience, with a minimum of 2 years of experience of operations assessment and operations research experience on a Combatant Command (COCOMS) staff or equivalent at the O-5 level equivalent or higher  MA/MS degree in operations research or a related field  Ability to work on high-visibility or mission critical aspects of a given program and performs all functional duties independently  Ability to oversee the efforts of less senior staff and/or be responsible for the efforts of all staff assigned to a specific job  Comprehensive operations assessment and OR experience  Ability to work independently or lead a small team in conducting analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency, or program criticality, requiring a variety of OR techniques and tools  Ability to communicate and prepare correspondence and presentations at the 4-Star General Officer level  Ability to develop and support, or direct others in developing and supporting, new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments  Ability to integrate, or direct others in integrating, analytical applications/software programs and Microsoft applications to support assessments  Ability to develop, or direct others in developing, data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis, developing and managing DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection

Essential Job Accountabilities:   Job Summary:  The Quality Data Analyst Senior provides continuous improvement support to the NCH Healthcare Group by functioning as an educator, analyst, facilitator and/or project manager as required. This individual will work throughout the system with a broad range of provider groups to leverage benchmarking and best practices to improve and promote patient and quality care. This position will serve as a facilitator for clinical performance improvement initiatives and guides the development, ongoing review, and implementation of evidence-based guidelines. The guidelines provided by national and medical organizations that provide strategies for health care quality measurement and reporting. Facilitates and supports multidisciplinary teams to achieve clinical performance improvement goals and objectives. This position will have responsibility for educating physicians, healthcare providers, and office staff in clinically approved documentation workflows. Position will identify opportunities for improvement and work closely with the EHR team to incorporate those improvements into the current systems. The Quality Data Analyst Senior will work as a team member with the EHR team, the Billing team, and the ACO project team to assure data entry is accurate and complete. At all times this employee will conduct their work efforts with the ultimate goal of providing high quality, efficient service for the patients and payers of the NCH Healthcare Group.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Facilitates, guides, and supports enterprise, departmental or cross-departmental continuous improvement work as directed by executive leadership. This encompasses preparation and planning for workshops and continued training, implementation and periodic audits of work completed. Serves as a lead to organize and delegate work assignments to quality data analysts. • Produces provider quality scorecards/dashboards and meets with providers to review. Assists leadership to develop proficiency in continuous improvement methodologies and approaches. Provides ongoing improvement training as well as serving as an educational resource. Participates in tactical planning for the continuous improvement work to be done in conjunction with numerous local and national healthcare organizations. Develops, maintains and revises work plans as appropriate and monitors outcomes. Integrates work with other departmental initiatives and revises as needed. Contributes to the development and promotion of standard work across the organization. Promotes the attainment of national goals through continued education. Works hand and hand with the EHR team in further development of the existing EHR systems in an effort to ensure the best patient quality care in line with national standards.  Continually tracks and regularly provides management/leadership updates as to the status of these goals. Including not limited to Meaningful Use, PQRS, and Quality Metrics, future metrics.   Education, Experience, Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare, Finance, IT, Quality or related field.  Minimum of 3 years of experience in a related field. Experience using PC applications such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Comprehensive knowledge of medical diagnostic & procedural terminology is required. Ability to work w/ & maintain confidentially of physician, patient accounts & personal data. Knowledge of outpatient coding practices at both clinical & inpatient settings. Required knowledge of compliance & regulatory requirements including outpatient CMS regulations. Strong interpersonal & excellent written, verbal & presentation skills. Possess a strong attention to detail, a personal commitment to accuracy and excellence, excellent communications and interpersonal and organization skills.  Prioritize workload & meet deadlines. Ability to read & interpret medical data.  Flexible depending upon department and/or physician schedule needs.  Review analytical data & audit findings to identify coding trends & other risk areas.  Develop data requirements & work w/analytical groups to extract, organize & analyze coded data. Clinical or Coding background.  A strong interest in measurement and statistics. Location: NCH Healthcare System · NCH ACO Schedule: Full-Time, Day, 0800-1630

Acceleration is WPP’s specialist practice for Google Marketing & Cloud Platforms. We are a curious team of highly skilled data and technology practitioners, inspired by experimentation and new ideas. This is the lifeblood of the future-forward solutions we deliver, that empower our clients to compete every day, in a dynamic environment. And it is the reason we have become trusted advisors to CEOs, strategic partners to CMOs, and operational partners to CIOs, around the globe. We help clients leverage the power of Google’s Marketing and Cloud platforms to transform their marketing organizations and accelerate growth. With access to expert consultancy services and a deep bench of specialized skills, we deliver what marketers need to compete effectively, increase efficiency, and drive growth. We are well known for our open, transparent, and honest relationships with clients. We identify opportunities for innovation while remaining firmly grounded in business reality. We demystify complex tasks and impart knowledge without hype or pretense, and we shape marketing ecosystems to drive growth through the intelligent application of data and technology. Most importantly, we speak in specifics and get the job done. Our contribution is measured by our clients’ success. We understand that speed to value is critical. This is why we release value at every step of the process. Every day we build our skills and hone our craft to get our clients the results they deserve. We are Acceleration: We turn bold ambition into business reality. ROLE   OVERVIEW : The Data Science Lead will have responsibility over a broad area of initiatives, tasked with developing solutions for our clients which drive business value. The candidate should be able to apply quantitative, analytical and data science skills to complex problems. They should be able to collaborate with internal and client teams to solution, implement, and analyze against the solution with the focus on the outcome to solve the business problem. The candidate is responsible for thought leadership and team development and ultimately developing data-centric solutions that increase the value we bring to our clients. AREA OF EXPERTIZE: Acceleration is part of WPP, the world’s largest advertising and marketing services group. Clients come to us to solve today’s biggest challenges, surrounding the use of data and technology, to support delivery of improved digital marketing experiences for their customers, across paid, owned and earned environments. Typically, their biggest area of investment is media, and using data and technology, to un-lock value in this area is critical. You will display a distinctive level of subject matter expertise on how to architect and deliver advertising / marketing technology and data strategies that accelerate client value, by increasing customer engagement and personalization in this area. Google is a key partner of ours, and a primary route to market – knowledge of the Google Marketing Platform as well as how Google Cloud can improve marketing efforts is a strong bonus. IDEAL CANDIDATE: The successful candidate will be eager to take on challenging business problems and apply solutions using platforms like Google Cloud Platform and open-sourced languages. The candidate will be able to design and implement end-to-end data pipelines using statistical, ML methods, and other tools on GCP. The candidate will be innovative and be able to translate statistical methods and results into everyday language for consumption and understanding by marketers and technical counterparts. Beyond GCP, the candidate will be able to create models and operationalize such models. The candidate will have experience with different data types and be able to orchestrate a data solution with the support of data engineers, implementation engineers, and solutions architects. The candidate must have extensive practical expertise and work experience with supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning. They also should have kept abreast of newer solutions like Deep Learning and how to use modern analytic and data tools. RESPONSIBILITIES: Design data pipelines with solutions architects and other stakeholders Supervise the technical direction of data science projects Contribute to product ideation and development Partner closely with Product, Engineering, and Analytics Translate data science outputs and insights to technical and non-technical audiences Create solutions within GCP and other systems that bring additional value to client projects Apply data mining techniques and statistical analysis to various types of internal and external data Work with engineering teams to operationalize Machine Learning models REQUIREMENTS: Demonstrated experience with the following: machine learning, data mining, computational analytics/optimization, application development, data mining, predictive modeling, deep learning Expertise in statistical frameworks, including causal media mix modeling, multi-touch attribution, causal inference, etc. Knowledgeable in using BigQuery, Cloud Dataproc, Google Data Studio, Cloud Dataflow, Spark, Hive, R, Python/Anaconda, TensorFlow a plus Advanced degree in analytical field (e.g. Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analysis, Operations Research, Data Science) A strong passion for problem solving and innovation Strong aptitude for numerical detail and analysis Expertise working with engineering teams to activate and operationalize Machine Learning models Strong communication skills Passionate about working in an extremely fast-paced, demanding, and fluid start-up environment as well as having a desire to build a company up from an early stage

Jackson Memorial Hospital FT Days, M-F  Position Summary: The Machine Learning Engineer designs, develops, troubleshoots, and debugs software programs as part of machine learning model creation and deployment. Works on feature engineering to ensure most information going into the model for prediction accuracy. A member of the data science team working to implement machine learning models as part of collaborative projects within the span of healthcare departments and business units. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand the business strategy. Follows machine learning model management and life-cycle best practice. This position is a highly technical role with knowledge of Python programing and machine learning libraries such as NumPy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-lean, etc. This role has a good understanding of advanced data science concepts, predictive analyics, and machine learning algorithms. This role mentors and validates projects for fellow team members.  Duties & Responsibilities: Works with teammates and departments to define business use cases for data analytics and opportunities for machine learning tool application. Assesses feasibility of projects and makes recommendations to leadership on approaches. Data collection from various sources for analysis, organization, and data-cleansing for use in machine learning processes. Collaborates with data custodians to build new data structures and views to support future growth of machine learning designs. Data analysis to produce insights into data. This includes applying machine learning tools and visualizations to provide departments and stakeholders with perspective for decision making. Data feature creation and selection. Using existing and creating new data sets to formulate accurate, clean data. Testing features to ensure relevance and value to machine learning models. Data model selection through training, testing, and evaluation. Using Python tools and libraries for introspective views into model performance. Providing feedback on model performance to the team and departments. Deployment of models into certification and production environments. Running models for scheduled deliverables and ensuring timely delivery of data visualization and outputs. Model evaluation and maintenance. Monitoring of model performance to ensure maximum performance. Performing adjustments to models and code to adjust as needed. Patching and maintenance of team servers and software. On call support for team processes and deliverables. Responds to support tickets and requests within SLA. Documentation of machine learning models and associated code. Creating and maintaining departmental documentation of team processes and knowledgebase. Contributing to department policies and creating best practices. Responsive to emails and calls/texts within a reasonable amount of time. Is attentive to ongoing issues or questions and replies back consistently. Takes initiative to intervene in issues that may arise. Works proactively to ensure department best practices are followed. Intervenes when observing improper procedure or practices. Mentorship and training of other team members. Provides build validation, design, and assists leaders to assess upcoming projects and opportunities. Demonstrates behaviors of service excellence and CARE values (Compassion, Accountability, Respect and Expertise). Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications  Experience: Generally requires 3 to 5 years of related experience. At least 1 year of experience required in Python programming as it relates to machine learning and data analytics is required. Experience with statistical analysis and data gathering is required.  Education: Bachelor's degree in related field is required. Master's degree is preferred.  License Certification: Valid license or certification is required as needed, based on the job or specialty.  Knowledge Skill Abilities: Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work accurately while meeting multiple deadlines. Ability to communicate effectively in both oral and written form. Ability to handle difficult and stressful situations with critical thinking and professional composure. Ability to understand and follow instructions. Ability to exercise sound and independent judgment. Knowledge and skill in use of job appropriate technology and software applications.  Physical Demands: Job function is sedentary in nature and requires sitting for extended periods of time. Function may require frequent standing or walking. Must be able to lift or carry objects weighing up to 20 pounds. Jobs in this group are required to have close visual acuity to perform activities such as: extended use of computers, preparing and analyzing data and analytics, and other components of a typical office environment. Additional information and provision requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by the home unit/department in collaboration with the Reasonable Accommodations Committee (RAC).  Work Environment: Jobs in this group are required to function in a fast paced environment with occasional high pressure or emergent and stressful situations. Frequent interaction with a diverse population including team members, providers, patients, insurance companies and other members of the public. Function is subject to inside environmental conditions, with occasional outdoor exposures. Possible exposure to various environments such as: communicable diseases, toxic substances, medicinal preparations and other conditions common to a hospital and medical office environment. May wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as gloves or a mask when exposed to hospital environment outside of office. Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions. Additional information and provision requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by the home unit/department in collaboration with the Reasonable Accommodations Committee (RAC).

job_Description: Summary  The Data and Analytics team is a nimble and highly impactful team that provides critical guidance, insights, and strategic frameworks to the senior leaders responsible for our various functions and business units. As an integral part of the team, the Senior Data Analyst will help us extract meaning from large volumes of data necessary to make informed business decisions. The Senior Data Analyst will be instrumental in setting the team vision, strategy and roadmap and work alongside stakeholders in the organization to make this happen.  The Senior Data Analyst works with business intelligence tools, can model multidimensional datasets, and partners with business leaders to answer key business questions. They are responsible for requirements gathering, report design/authoring, ad-hoc analysis, quality assurance and documenting artifacts related to the report development lifecycle. The Senior Data Analyst utilizes strong business and technical knowledge to ensure the highest level of service and efficiency for the customer. This role may provide leadership and supervisory oversight to others.  General Responsibilities  Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following. Other duties and responsibilities may be assigned.  Execute the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.  Translate general reporting requests from the business into data requirements, acquire data from multiple sources, and develop reports to satisfy the immediate business need, with a strategic focus on anticipating future needs.  Work with business partners to translate data related questions into structured analyses and share findings of analyses in a concise and persuasive manner.  Lead the development of new methodologies to move our analytics capabilities forward.  Leverage sufficient understanding of the business and strategy to provide business recommendations to business units including (but not limited to) Marketing, Business Development, Recruitment Teams, Student Support, Partnerships and Finance.  Collaborate within a team environment to develop relevant and repeatable policies and procedures for preparing business reports and departmental processes.  Define the data elements and data structure that our team should leverage to enable analytical and reporting capabilities for our business development team.  Work with engineering and data warehouse to appropriately capture and store key data points.  Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.  Preparing and delivering business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks.  Act as a Subject Matter Expert in the areas of data analysis, analytics and data programs.  Participate in strategic & tactical planning discussions   Qualifications  General Qualifications  7-9 years of experience in designing and authoring reports/dashboards using Tableau (or similar tools like Looker, Power BI, Qlik) is required.  3-4 years of experience working with Salesforce  5-7 years of experience writing complex queries using SQL (preferably Google Big Query)  Prior experience with Data Science languages like Python, and/or R is highly desirable  Advanced experience working with analytics models like multi-touch attribution (MTA), workforce optimization, forecasting, lead scoring, customer retention etc.  Analytics experience in machine learning and predictive modelling is highly desired  Ability to work within a cross-functional team setting and shifting priorities  Good communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to interact with diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning organizational levels.  Demonstrated ability to use discretion and make sound decisions  Experience with Higher Education is highly desired   Supervisory Responsibilities  May provide supervision and have oversight of others.
